basics.name: Kyle Romero
basics.label: Director of Software Development
basics.summary: Hands-on and results-driven software engineering leader specializing in management, full-stack development, digital transformation, software architecture, DevOps, and Agile methodologies. Proven track record of delivering scalable, business-aligned solutions, optimizing development operations, and mentoring high-performing teams.

highlights: Led software development team focused on product development, enhancement, and release management.

Tenna Online is a construction-industry SaaS platform offering real-time GPS, BLE, and IoT asset tracking to manage fleets, schedule maintenance, and improve utilization across mixed equipment operations.
Tech Stack: AWS, GitHub, Kubernetes, Helm, Docker, FluxCD (GitOps), SingleSpa (Micro-UI), Hapi, React, Redux, RabbitMQ, Redis, Elasticsearch, Postgres, Grafana, Confluence.

work.summary: Staffing, IT Services, and Workforce Solutions | 12k Employees
highlights: Short-term contract focused on API development, data integration, and cloud architecture for Deloitte Consulting.
Client: Deloitte Consulting (Energy Industry client in Chicago).

Tech Stack: Azure Cloud, Containerized Node Express API (Azure App Services), .NET Microservices (Azure Functions), Angular front end, SAP/CC&B backend, Tibco + Boomi data integrations, Redis cache, CosmosDB, MS SQL (Azure), Azure DevOps, Confluence.
Led software development organization overseeing architectural strategy and implementation of modern UI, API, and data integration architecture.
Managed 3 Managers (AppDev, Oracle, Data Integrations/API Teams), 4 Architects, and 30 Developers (internal, near-shore, offshore).
Tech Stack: React, .NET (C#, UWP, ASP.NET Core), SQL Server, Oracle, Azure, AWS, Windows Server, Git (Azure DevOps), Boomi, Snowflake.
Major initiatives included ERP migration to NetSuite, WMS migration to Körber, omnichannel e-commerce integration, and 3rd-party API integrations (ChargeAfter, Bringg).
Defined and implemented organizational strategy (1- and 5-year), goals (OKRs), Agile and DevOps processes, 24/7 support strategy, and coding/review standards.
Aligned cross-functional teams within matrixed IT organization and coordinated with infrastructure, product management, BI, design, and e-commerce teams.
Negotiated and managed vendor contracts and budgets, achieving 40% YoY cost reduction.

work.company: MEARS Group, A Quanta Services Company
highlights: Managed software development team as hands-on technical lead overseeing requirements discovery, architecture, full-stack development, QA, DevOps, and production support.
Administered systems including on-prem Windows Servers, Azure DevOps, and Azure subscriptions.
Team Size: 4 Developers, 1 PM, 7 Offshore (100% remote).
Tech Stack: .NET (C#, ASP.NET Core, Blazor), SQL Server, Sqlite3, Azure / Windows Server, JavaScript (Angular / Node / Electron), Git, PowerBI, PowerAutomate, Java (Spring Boot).
Developed mission-critical SOX-compliant, high-availability internal revenue/time/equipment capture solution used by 700+ field crews nationwide, reducing closing process time by 75%.
Promotions: Manager (2017–2020), Senior Manager (2020–2021), Director (2021–2023).
Implemented DevOps, CICD, Agile Scrum, Kanban, and GitFlow, increasing delivery speed by 50%.
Traveled to multiple U.S. locations to roll out applications and lead change management (25% travel).
Led internal software development team of 3 internal and 5 contract developers, reporting directly to company co-owner.
Developed mission-critical asset management software (desktop, mobile, and web) managing $300M in heavy machinery assets.
Built mobile-first SPA to provide real-time telemetry data on equipment.
Implemented Agile Scrum and DevOps practices to optimize team delivery.
Designated technical lead over mission-critical 3rd-level support tool used by 10k+ global users.
Delivered enterprise 3-tier web applications using .NET, MS SQL, and JavaScript.
Led system split and cloning during HP’s corporate division into HP Inc. and HPE.
Titles: Senior Developer (2011–2013), Technical Lead (2013–2016).
Developed ASP.NET/C# web applications for MSSQL backends and designed WinForms / Console apps.
Handled database design, server administration (Windows/Linux), and scripting (Shell/Batch/C++).
Built machine monitoring and inventory tracking systems deployed globally.

work.summary: Internship between TTU EE Department and X-Fab, Texas
highlights: Developed internal software projects including statistical analysis tools, format converters, and .NET web applications.
